term.title: xerogel

item.text: Open network formed by the removal of all swelling agents from a gel.

notes.item: Examples of xerogels include silica gel and dried out, compact, macromolecular structures, such as gelatin or rubber.
The definition proposed here is recommended as being more explicit.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 1801. 'Definitions of terms relating to the structure and processing of sols, gels, networks, and inorganic-organic hybrid materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2007)' on page 1808 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779101801)
